From: Vladimir Bossicard <vladimir@...>

> i don't manage to install junit1.0,even if i add in the autoexec.bat:
> set classpath= c:\junit.jar;c:\junit

the junit.jar must be in the classpath, not only the directory containing the
Jar.
a good tip is to never set the classpath variable but only give the classpath
via the -classpath option.  Here the go.bat of one of my projects (my
*.classes files are stored into the .\classes directory)

java -classpath j:\Java\junit3.5\junit.jar;.\classes junit.swingui.TestRunner

Regards

Vladimir Bossicard
subject: Re: [junit] help please!!
